newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE grains lower as fresh farm selling seen.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE grains lower as fresh farm selling seen.

text.p: LIFFE grains eased, with some fresh farm selling taking July lower, while the new crop took its weak trend to new contract lows.
"You've seen a lot of fresh farmer selling on July," one trader said.
Old crop futures had maintained their recent weakness, he said.
November last traded at a new contract low at 90.85 stg, 1.30 stg lower. The previous low was 91.75 stg, on May 20.
November was the most active contract on wheat, with 294 of a total 444 lots traded.
July traded 110 lots. It last changed hands 0.45 stg lower at 85.75 stg.
November was most active on barley with 15 of a total 19 lots. It last traded 1.25 stg lower at 88.75 stg.
UK cash grains continued to drift lower on Friday, but trade remained thin.
"There is still a lack of sellers in the market as they hold out for higher prices, but I can't see that happening," said one broker.
